intro: Echinorhyncha ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian echinorhyncha, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure that splits open to release seeds. Echinorhyncha ecuadorensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
